title: Field Worker Hygiene
description: Comprehensive hygiene requirements for field workers including toilet facilities, hand washing stations, hygiene practices, glove use, jewelry restrictions, and designated eating/break areas. Applies to on-the-farm workers, not harvesting workers.

requirements.text: Are toilet facilities adequate in number and location? A ZERO POINT (NON-CONFORMANCE) DOWN SCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THIS AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: Toilet facilities are provided in adequate number based on workforce size
Ratio meets or exceeds regulatory requirements (e.g., 1 toilet per 20 workers)
Toilets are located within reasonable distance of work areas
Facilities are accessible to workers during work hours
Separate facilities or alternating access for different genders where required
Additional facilities provided during peak seasons if workforce increases
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual assessment of toilet adequacy, immediate assessment when workforce size changes
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly verification that toilet capacity meets workforce needs

requirements.text: Are toilet facilities located where they are not a risk of contamination to product, packaging, equipment, water sources and growing areas?
mandatoryStatements: Toilets are located away from product handling and storage areas
Toilets are not positioned where leaks or drainage can contaminate growing areas
Toilets are not located near water sources used for agricultural purposes
Distance and positioning prevent contamination of equipment
Distance and positioning prevent contamination of packaging materials
Drainage from toilets is controlled and directed away from production areas
Location considers wind direction and potential for airborne contamination
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of toilet location relative to production areas
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly inspection for signs of leakage or contamination risk

requirements.text: Are toilet facilities designed and maintained to prevent contamination (e.g., free from leaks and cracks)?
mandatoryStatements: Toilet facilities are structurally sound
No leaks present in toilets or waste holding tanks
No cracks in walls, floors, or fixtures
Seals and joints are intact
Doors close properly and have functional latches
Ventilation is adequate
Regular maintenance prevents deterioration
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly inspection of toilet facility condition
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly inspection for leaks and damage, immediate repair of deficiencies

requirements.text: Are toilet facilities constructed of materials that are easy to clean?
mandatoryStatements: Interior surfaces are smooth and non-porous
Materials are durable and withstand regular cleaning
Floors, walls, and fixtures can be effectively sanitized
No difficult-to-clean crevices or unsealed joints
Materials resist moisture and do not harbor bacteria
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual assessment of toilet facility materials and cleanability

requirements.text: Are toilet facilities supplied with toilet paper and is the toilet paper maintained properly (e.g., toilet paper rolls are not stored on the floor or in the urinals)?
mandatoryStatements: Toilet paper is provided in all toilet facilities
Adequate supply is maintained at all times
Toilet paper is stored in dispensers or holders, not on floor
Toilet paper is protected from contamination
Extra rolls are stored in sanitary manner if kept in stalls
Restocking occurs regularly to prevent shortages
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly inspection of toilet paper supply and storage
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification that toilet paper is stocked, immediate restocking when needed

requirements.text: Where used, is there a documented procedure for emptying the waste holding tanks in a hygienic manner and also in a way that prevents product, packaging, equipment, water systems and growing area contamination?
mandatoryStatements: Written procedure for waste tank emptying exists (if portable toilets used)
Procedure specifies frequency of pumping based on usage
Procedure defines how to prevent spills during pumping
Procedure prohibits emptying tanks near product, packaging, equipment, or water sources
Procedure specifies approved waste disposal locations
Procedure requires cleaning/sanitizing of pumping equipment between uses if applicable
Records of waste tank servicing are maintained
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly review of waste tank pumping records
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate documentation after each pumping, verification that procedure is followed

requirements.text: Are the toilet facilities and hand washing stations clean and are there records showing cleaning, servicing and stocking occurring regularly?
mandatoryStatements: Toilet facilities are visibly clean
Hand washing stations are visibly clean
Cleaning schedule is established based on usage
Cleaning records document date, time, and person responsible
Records show regular servicing (waste removal, repairs)
Records show regular stocking (toilet paper, soap, towels)
Cleaning frequency increases during peak usage periods
Non-conformances identified during inspections are corrected promptly
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly inspection of facility cleanliness, monthly audit of cleaning records
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily cleaning during active use, immediate cleaning if soiled

requirements.text: Is hand washing signage posted appropriately?
mandatoryStatements: Hand washing signs are posted at or near toilet facilities
Hand washing signs are posted at hand washing stations
Signs are posted at entry points to production areas
Signs are in language(s) understood by workers
Signs include visual instructions for proper hand washing technique
Signs are visible, clean, and in good condition
Additional signage reminds workers when hand washing is required
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly inspection of signage presence and condition
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly verification of signage, immediate replacement if damaged

requirements.text: Are hand washing stations adequate in number and appropriately located for worker access and monitoring usage? A ZERO POINT (NON-CONFORMANCE) DOWN SCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THIS AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: Hand washing stations are provided in adequate number
Stations are located at or near toilet facilities
Stations are located at entry points to production areas
Stations are accessible without entering production area directly from toilets
Location enables monitoring of worker hand washing compliance
Additional stations provided at convenient locations throughout work areas
Number of stations accommodates workforce size without excessive waiting
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly assessment of hand washing station adequacy and positioning
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification that all stations are operational, immediate repair if out of service

requirements.text: Are the hand wash stations designed and maintained properly (e.g., ability to capture or control rinse water to prevent contamination onto product, packaging, and growing area, free of clogged drains, etc.)?
mandatoryStatements: Hand washing stations capture or control rinse water
Drainage prevents contamination of product, packaging, and growing areas
Drains are not clogged
Stations are maintained in good working order
Water supply is adequate and functional
Stations are stable and do not tip or leak
Catch basins or drainage systems are cleaned regularly
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly inspection of hand washing station condition and drainage
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly verification of proper function, immediate repair of drainage issues

requirements.text: Are hand wash stations adequately stocked with unscented soap and paper towels?
mandatoryStatements: Soap is provided at all hand washing stations
Soap is unscented to prevent product contamination
Paper towels are provided for hand drying
Supplies are maintained at adequate levels
Dispensers are functional
Restocking occurs regularly to prevent shortages
No scented soap, lotion, or hand sanitizer that could contaminate product
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly inspection of hand washing station supplies
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification of soap and towel availability, immediate restocking when needed

requirements.text: Are workers washing and sanitizing their hands before starting work each day, after using the restroom, after breaks, before putting on gloves and whenever hands may be contaminated?
mandatoryStatements: Workers wash hands before starting work each day
Workers wash hands after using restroom
Workers wash hands after breaks
Workers wash hands before putting on gloves
Workers wash hands whenever hands may be contaminated
Hand washing procedure includes soap, scrubbing, rinsing, and drying
Sanitizing may follow hand washing where required
Supervisors monitor hand washing compliance
Workers are trained on proper hand washing technique and timing
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily observation of worker hand washing compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous supervision, immediate correction of non-compliance

requirements.text: Are workers who are working directly or indirectly with product free of jewelry and wearing clean clothing appropriate for their duties?
mandatoryStatements: Workers do not wear jewelry that could contaminate product (rings, bracelets, watches, etc.)
Plain wedding bands may be allowed if policy permits
Workers wear clean clothing appropriate for their duties
Clothing is changed if soiled or contaminated
Hair is restrained (hats, hairnets) where appropriate
Policy on jewelry and dress code is documented and communicated
Supervisors enforce jewelry and clothing requirements
Workers are trained on jewelry and clothing rules
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily observation of worker compliance with jewelry and clothing rules
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous supervision, immediate correction of violations

requirements.text: When workers are using gloves, are the gloves appropriate for the task, clean, intact and changed as required?
mandatoryStatements: Gloves are appropriate for the task (food contact-safe, right material)
Gloves are clean when donned
Gloves are intact, without holes or tears
Gloves are changed when soiled, damaged, or contaminated
Gloves are changed after restroom use
Gloves are changed after handling non-food items
Workers wash hands before putting on new gloves
Glove use does not substitute for hand washing
Used gloves are disposed of properly
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily observation of glove use and condition
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous supervision, immediate correction if gloves are soiled or damaged

requirements.text: Do workers have access to drinking water and is there no evidence of cups or water bottles in food handling or production areas?
mandatoryStatements: Potable drinking water is provided for workers
Water is easily accessible without entering production areas
Designated drinking water stations or areas are established
Personal water bottles and cups are not allowed in production areas
Workers understand rules about where they can drink
Breaks are provided allowing workers to access drinking water
Adequate cups/containers provided at drinking stations if needed
Drinking occurs only in designated areas away from product
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily inspection of production areas for personal water bottles
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous supervision, immediate removal of unauthorized beverages from production areas

requirements.text: Are all tobacco products, food items, beverages and personal effects (e.g., cell phones, purses, backpacks) prohibited from food handling or storage areas?
mandatoryStatements: Tobacco products prohibited in production and storage areas
Worker food and beverages prohibited in production and storage areas
Personal effects (cell phones, purses, backpacks) prohibited in production and storage areas
Designated areas provided for storage of personal items
Policy is documented and communicated to workers
Supervisors enforce prohibition
Violations result in corrective action
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily inspection of production areas for prohibited items
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous supervision, immediate removal of prohibited items

requirements.text: Are there designated eating, drinking and break areas that are maintained in a clean condition and managed so that they are not a contamination risk to product, equipment, packaging and growing areas?
mandatoryStatements: Designated eating and break areas are established
Areas are clearly marked and communicated to workers
Eating/break areas are located away from production and storage areas
Areas are maintained in clean condition
Waste receptacles are provided and emptied regularly
Hand washing stations are available near eating areas
Workers wash hands after breaks before returning to work
Eating areas do not pose contamination risk to product, equipment, or growing areas
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly inspection of eating/break area cleanliness and location
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily cleaning of eating areas, immediate cleanup of spills or waste

requirements.text: Are field workers demonstrating acceptable hygiene behavior during the farm inspection?
mandatoryStatements: Workers demonstrate proper hygiene during inspection
Workers follow hand washing requirements
Workers comply with jewelry and clothing rules
Workers use gloves properly if applicable
Workers do not engage in prohibited behaviors (eating in production areas, spitting, etc.)
Supervisors are actively monitoring hygiene compliance
Workers respond appropriately to corrections
Overall hygiene culture is evident
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous supervision by management, immediate correction of any hygiene violations

capaInject: If toilets inadequate in number or location: provide additional facilities immediately, audit fails if zero points
If toilets located where they pose contamination risk: relocate toilets or implement barriers within 30 days, enhanced monitoring until corrected
If toilets have leaks or cracks: immediate repair, if not repairable replace within 14 days
If toilet paper not supplied: immediate stocking, establish daily verification
If waste tank procedure not documented: develop procedure within 7 days, train personnel
If toilets/hand wash stations not clean: immediate cleaning, establish daily cleaning schedule
If hand washing signage not posted: post signs immediately
If hand wash stations inadequate: provide additional stations immediately, audit fails if zero points
If hand wash stations not properly maintained: immediate repair, daily verification
If soap/towels not stocked: immediate restocking, establish daily verification
If workers not washing hands: immediate retraining, enhanced supervision, disciplinary action for repeat violations
If workers wearing jewelry or dirty clothing: immediate removal/change, retraining, disciplinary action
If gloves inappropriate or not changed: immediate correction, provide proper gloves, retrain workers
If water bottles in production area: immediate removal, retrain workers on policy
If prohibited items in production area: immediate removal, retrain workers, disciplinary action
If eating areas not designated or maintained: designate areas immediately, establish cleaning schedule
If workers demonstrate unacceptable hygiene: immediate retraining, enhanced supervision, disciplinary action up to removal from food handling
traceabilityInject: Toilet cleaning and servicing records must be traceable to dates, times, and responsible personnel
Hand washing station inspections must be traceable to inspection dates and findings
Worker hygiene training records must be traceable to specific training dates and attendees
Worker hygiene violations must be traceable to specific incidents, corrective actions, and retraining
